page.title: 18Aircraft Wreck James Thorn
page.content: On the evening of{18th May, 1945 a {lancaster bomber}number{KB993}of{ {408}squadron was returning home to{ {Canada}after the war. The pilot was flying over{Bleaklow}when in the distance he saw the lights of Glossop. As he descended he suddenly saw the rocks of{James Thorn}coming into view. The pilot tried to clear the hill but he just clipped the top.{Six} of the crew were killed in the crash. The tail gunner survived for a time but died later of his wounds. Soon after{408}squadron left for Canada leaving {lancaster KB993}behind on the rocks of James Thorn. Now there are only a few scraps of metal left, marking the site of the crash. (Ordnance Survey grid reference: 079949). There are about 50 wrecks of historic aircraft in this area of the Dark Peak.
